title: Will Russia Pay for Ukraine’s War Damage?
sub_head: The ruin is overwhelming, but securing reparations will be legally and politically difficult.
body:
Irpin, Ukraine
When Petro Kornoukh, 55, returned to his home in this war-torn city just west of Kyiv, he discovered that artillery and explosions had damaged his roof, shattered his windows, blown his doors open—and “the fence just flew away.” He says he spent his last $1,000 buying metal to rebuild the fence.
